alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Hardeman; McNairy (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 25 at 7:20PM CDT until June 25 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Union County in northeastern Mississippi... Northern Marshall County in northwestern Mississippi... Tippah County in northeastern Mississippi... Benton County in northeastern Mississippi... Northwestern Prentiss County in northeastern Mississippi... Alcorn County in northeastern Mississippi... Eastern Fayette County in west Tennessee... Hardeman County in west Tennessee... Southern McNairy County in west Tennessee... * Until 800 PM CDT. * At 719 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Lagrange, or 21 miles east of Collierville, moving southeast at 75 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Corinth, Booneville, Holly Springs, Bolivar, Ripley, Selmer, Big Hill Pond State Park, Lamar, Whiteville, Somerville, Blue Mountain, Jumpertown, Snow Lake Shores, Theo, Canaan, Pocahontas, Lagrange, Hinkle, Slayden and Mt Pleasant. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
